title: E field - force and field for H and He nuclei

content.description: A hydrogen nucleus (charge <math alttext="positive lowercase e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi></mpadded></math>) experiences a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> after entering a region of space with a uniform electric field of magnitude <math alttext="Uppercase E sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. If a helium nucleus (charge <math alttext="positive 2 times lowercase e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>e</mi></mpadded></math>) enters the same region, what magnitude of electric force and electric field will it experience?
